children.title: Restrict Internet Access and Protect Critical Systems from General IT Environment
children.content: No content provided

children.title: Swift Environment Protection
children.content: Ensure the protection of the user’s Swift infrastructure from potentially compromised elements of the general IT environment and external environment.

children.title: Operating System Privileged Account Control
children.content:
Restrict and control the allocation and usage of administrator-level operating system 
accounts.

children.title: Virtualisation or Cloud Platform Protection
children.content:
Secure the virtualisation or cloud platform and virtual machines (VMs) that host Swift-related 
components to the same level as physical systems.

children.title: Restriction of Internet Access
children.content: Control/Protect Internet access from operator PCs and systems within the secure zone.

children.title: Customer Environment Protection
children.content:
Ensure the protection of the customer’s connectivity infrastructure from external environment 
and potentially compromised elements of the general IT environment.

children.title: Reduce Attack Surface and Vulnerabilities
children.content: No content provided

children.title: Internal Data Flow Security
children.content:
Ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and authenticity of application data flows between ’user’s 
Swift-related components.

children.title: Security Updates
children.content:
Minimise the occurrence of known technical vulnerabilities on operator PCs and within the 
user’s Swift infrastructure by ensuring vendor support, applying mandatory software updates, and applying timely 
security updates aligned to the assessed risk.

children.title: System Hardening
children.content:
Reduce the cyber-attack surface of Swift-related components by performing system 
hardening.

children.title: Back Office Data Flow Security
children.content:
Ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and mutual authenticity of data flowing between on
premises or remote Swift infrastructure components and the back-office first hops they connect to.

children.title: External Transmission Data Protection
children.content:
Protect the confidentiality of Swift-related sensitive data transmitted or stored outside of the 
secure zone as part of operational processes.

children.title: Operator Session Confidentiality and Integrity
children.content:
Protect the confidentiality and integrity of interactive operator sessions that connect to the on
premises or remote (operated by a service provider or outsourcing agent) Swift infrastructure or to a service 
provider or outsourcing agent Swift-related applications.

children.title: Vulnerability Scanning
children.content:
Identify known vulnerabilities within the user’s Swift environment by implementing a regular 
vulnerability scanning process and act upon results.

children.title: Outsourced Critical Activity Protection
children.content:
Ensure the protection, in line with the CSCF, of the user’s Swift infrastructure from risks 
exposed by the outsourcing of critical activities.

children.title: Transaction Business Controls
children.content: Ensure outbound transaction activity within the expected bounds of normal business.

children.title: Application Hardening
children.content:
Reduce the attack surface of Swift-related components by performing application hardening 
on the Swift-compatible messaging and communication interfaces, the Swift connector and related applications.

children.title: RMA Business Controls
children.content: Restrict transaction activity to validated and approved business counterparties.

children.title: Physically Secure the Environment
children.content: No content provided

children.title: Physical Security
children.content:
Prevent unauthorised physical access to sensitive equipment, workplace environments, 
hosting sites, and storage.

children.title: Prevent Compromise of Credentials
children.content: No content provided

children.title: Password Policy
children.content:
Ensure passwords are sufficiently resistant against common password attacks by 
implementing and enforcing an effective password policy.

children.title: Multi-Factor Authentication
children.content:
Prevent that a compromise of a single authentication factor allows access into Swift-related 
systems or applications by implementing multi-factor authentication.

children.title: Manage Identities and Separate Privileges
children.content: No content provided

children.title: Logical Access Control
children.content:
Enforce the security principles of need-to-know access, least privilege, and separation of 
duties for operator accounts.

children.title: Token Management
children.content:
Ensure the proper management, tracking, and use of connected and disconnected hardware 
authentication or personal and software tokens (when tokens are used).

children.title: Staff Screening Process
children.content:
To the extent permitted and practicable, ensure the trustworthiness of staff operating the 
user’s Swift environment by performing regular staff screening

children.title: Password Repository Protection
children.content: Protect physically and logically the repository of recorded passwords.

children.title:
Detect Anomalous Activity to Systems or 
Transaction Records
children.content: No content provided

children.title: Malware Protection
children.content: Ensure that the user’s Swift infrastructure is protected against malware and act upon results.

children.title: Software Integrity
children.content: Ensure the software integrity of the Swift-related components and act upon results.

children.title: Database Integrity
children.content:
Ensure the integrity of the database records for the Swift messaging interface or the 
customer connector and act upon results.

children.title: Logging and Monitoring
children.content:
Record security events, detect and respond to anomalous actions and operations within the 
user’s Swift environment.

children.title: Intrusion Detection
children.content:
Detect and contain anomalous network activity into the on-premises or remote Swift 
environment.

children.title:
Plan for Incident Response and Information 
Sharing
children.content: No content provided

children.title: Cyber Incident Response Planning
children.content: Ensure a consistent and effective approach for the management of cyber incidents.

children.title: Security Training and Awareness
children.content: No content provided

children.title: Penetration Testing
children.content:
Validate the operational security configuration and identify security gaps by performing 
penetration testing.

children.title: Scenario-based Risk Assessment
children.content:
Evaluate the risk and readiness of the organisation based on plausible cyber-attack 
scenarios.
